title: FOCUS: The Workflow of Headshot Photographer Peter Hurley
summary: A documentary-style profile of Peter Hurley, a world-renowned headshot photographer. The video explores his transition from Olympian to photographer, his unique approach to directing subjects to capture genuine expressions, his intense studio management style, and the challenge of balancing a high-drive career with family life.

steps.action: Execute the photoshoot with high energy and specific lighting
Direct the subject using psychology ('90% therapist')
Coach the subject to stop 'thinking' to get natural reactions
Delegate business logistics to a partner
Mentor a protégé to maintain quality standards
Critique and refine shots instantly (e.g., fixing hair, angles)
Balance professional drive with family time

key_takeaways: Photography is described as '90% therapist' work; the connection with the subject is paramount.
Genuine expression can override technical imperfections.
Micromanagement is presented as a necessary tool for maintaining a specific high-level vision.
Success involves a constant balancing act between creative ambition, business logistics, and personal life.
